related_questions.question: What is NodeJS used for?
related_questions.answer_text: Node. js is an open-source, cross-platform JavaScript runtime environment and library for running web applications outside the client's browser. Ryan Dahl developed it in 2009, and its latest iteration, version 15.14, was released in April 2021. Developers use Node.Feb 3, 2023

related_questions.question: Is NodeJS backend or frontend?
related_questions.answer_text: Node. js is sometimes misunderstood by developers as a backend framework that is exclusively used to construct servers. This is not the case; Node. js can be used on the frontend as well as the backend.Feb 6, 2023

related_questions.question: Is NodeJS a programming language?
related_questions.answer_text: Node. js is not a programming language. Rather, it's a runtime environment that's used to run JavaScript outside the browser.Mar 9, 2023

related_questions.question: Is NodeJS better than Java?
related_questions.answer_text: It's simpler than Java. It's ideal for full-stack developers. It offers faster and easier code writing. It has a node package manager, letting you store many libraries in one line.Mar 1, 2023

knowledge_graph.title: Node.js
knowledge_graph.subtitle: Platform
knowledge_graph.description: Node.js is a cross-platform, open-source server environment that can run on Windows, Linux, Unix, macOS, and more. Node.js is a back-end JavaScript runtime environment, runs on the V8 JavaScript Engine, and executes JavaScript code outside a web browser.

Operating system:.value: z/OS, Linux, macOS, Microsoft Windows, SmartOS, FreeBSD, OpenBSD, IBM AIX

Developer:.value: Microsoft Corporation, Ryan Dahl, OpenJS Foundation, Bryan Cantrill
